Sentence.sentence: Most of the training for advanced-math competitions happens outside the confines of the normal school day.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The prime minister denied there was a connection between his news adviser's outside interests and the change in legislative programme.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Interactions among themselves outside the classroom.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: 83% of workers say they're stressed about  their jobs, nearly 50% say work-related stress is interfering with their sleep, and 60% use their smartphones  to check in with work outside of normal working hours.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The shift, little noticed outside the medical establishment but already controversial inside it, suggests that doctors are starting to redefine their roles, from being concerned exclusively about individual patients to exerting influence on how healthcare dollars are spent.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Even if the question is ostensibly (表面上) about something outside the self (describe a fictional character or solve a problem of geopolitics), the essay invariably returns to the favorite topic: what is its impact on YOU?
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The question you are supposed to write about may seem outside the self, but the theme of the essay should center around its impact on you
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In fact, most children outside of the United States are expected to become bilingual or even, in many cases, multilingual.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But today, most graduates end up working outside academia, not only in industry but also in careers such as science policy, communications, and patent law
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: They often have to seek jobs outside the academic circle.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It should be re-oriented to careers outside academia
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: a parent, relative, friend, or doctor outside the family, had higher self-esteem, higher grades, and lower substance use than peers whose role models were sports figures, singers, or other media characters.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: They say that they are drawn to the prospect of learning applications outside the classroom, though such lesson plans have yet to surface
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: University officials claim that they dole out iPhones and iPods so as to facilitate students' learning outside of class.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: facilitate students' learning outside of class
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: He lived outside conventional ideas, he implied, because "I live alone mostly, in the middle of nowhere.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Outside the US, Google has made sure only to scan books that are out of copyright and thus in the "public domain" (works such as the Bodleian's first edition of Middle march, which anyone can read for free on Google Books Search).
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Applicants from outside the traditional sectors.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The curtains were never drawn, even at night, so guests got a view of the lake and fountains outside which were lit up at night – a very attractive sight.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: I think that it's grossly overstated that one needs to have contact with the opposite sex right through the whole of life, in the classroom and outside the classroom and at all ages
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: They are better sheltered from all the outside temptations.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: They are more or less isolated from the outside world
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: And I'd imagine you would be doing quire a lot of teaching outside the school, and moving around quite a bit.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: 83% of workers say they're stressed about their jobs, nearly 50% say work-related stress is interfering with their sleep, and 60% use their smartphones to check in with work outside of normal working hours.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Although many of the churches appear from the outside to be complex structures, they normally feature only a single storey but numerous different roof levels.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Anything you do that advances your presence—especially in a larger sphere, outside the communities you know一is a net win.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: If you are a manufacturer who relies on outside distributors, then retailers are the ideal partner for collecting old products.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Last year, a child was born at a hospital in the UK with her heart outside her body.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Most successful people are unorthodox persons whose minds wander outside traditional ways of thinking.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Our attitudes prompt us to go outside to enjoy roller-skating.
Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: Reducing waste by incorporating med materials into production can cut costs and decrease the price of procurement: less to be procured from the outside and more to be re-utilized from the inside.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: The shift, little noticed outside the medical establishment but already controversial inside it, suggests that doctors are starting to redefine their roles, from being concerned exclusively about individual patients to exerting influence on how healthcare
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Try to not have lunch at your desk, but instead spend time outside or with your friends一not talking about work.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均可表示"外部的"之意。
means: external ： 指与其他物体分离或没有关系的外部，不涉及内容，只说明全然是外部的。
exterior ： 强调位于事物的外表以上，但仍是该事物的一部分，较正式。
outer ： 主要提离开中心或内部较远的，或指比较在外的。
outside ： 指超出某种界限之外的。
outward ： 多指空间关系或方向上向外的。

stems_affixes.value_cn: 值得考虑的, 相当可观的
stems_affixes.word_buile: consider[v.考虑,细想;体谅,顾及;认为,把…看作]+able能……的→adj.值得考虑的, 相当可观的
consider考虑+ate……的→考虑到的
side旁边→n.边, 旁边, 面;adj.旁边的, 侧面的
in进入+side边→adj.&n.&adv.里面[的,地],内部[的,地]
out外面+side边→adj.&n.&adv.外面[的,地],外部[的,地]
considerable[adj.值得考虑的, 相当可观的]+ly表副词→considerably相当地
preside[v.[at,over]主持]+ent人→主持[的人]
preside主持+ium地方或团体→n.主席团
reside[v.居住,驻扎;属于]+nce→n.住处,住宅
considerate[adj.考虑周到的,体谅的]+ion表名词→consideration体谅, 考虑
side旁边→n.边, 旁边, 面;adj.旁边的, 侧面的
side旁边+way路→n.小路, 小巷,人行道
sub下+side坐→坐下去→平息
super在……上面+sede=side坐→坐上去→淘汰[以前的东西]

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"出去.过时,外面"; 2. 表示"超过.过度"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 室外的, 户外的, 野外的
stems_affixes.word_buile: out出去.过时,外面+door门→adj.室外的, 户外的, 野外的
out出去.过时,外面+er→adj.外部的,外面的,外层的
out出去.过时,外面+going走→走出来→心胸宽→待人友善的
out出去.过时,外面+land地+ish……的→外地来的→奇异的
out出去.过时,外面+ward方向→向外的
out超过.过度+size范围→范围超出
out超过.过度+standing标准的→adj.突出的, 显著的
out出去.过时,外面→adv.出外;在外 v.公布
out出去.过时,外面+door户+s→n.户外 adv.在户外, 在野外
out出去.过时,外面+side旁边→在外边
out出去.过时,外面+ward方向→向外的
out出去.过时,外面+break中断→事情断裂→爆发
out出去.过时,外面+door户+s→n.户外 adv.在户外, 在野外
out出去.过时,外面+flow流→流出

stems_affixes.value_cn: 外出, 旅行, 散步
stems_affixes.word_buile: out出去.过时,外面+ing状态→n.外出, 旅行, 散步
out出去.过时,外面+let表名词→n.出口, 出路
out出去.过时,外面+line线条→划出线条→大纲

stems_affixes.value_cn: 景色, 风光, 观点
stems_affixes.word_buile: out出去.过时,外面+look看→n.景色, 风光, 观点

stems_affixes.value_cn: 产量, 输出, 输出量
stems_affixes.word_buile: out出去.过时,外面+put放,摆→放出,输出→产量
out出去.过时,外面+rage怒气→怒气外露→粗暴
out出去.过时,外面+set安置好→在外面放置好→开端
out出去.过时,外面+skirt裙子;引申为城市周边+s→郊区
out出去.过时,外面+work工作→户外工作;在工作上胜过
out超过.过度+law法律→超越法律之人
out出去.过时,外面→adv.出外;在外 v.公布
out出去.过时,外面+flow流→流出
out出去.过时,外面+work工作→户外工作;在工作上胜过
out超过.过度+bid出价→出价超出
out超过.过度+do做→做得超出别人
out超过.过度+live活→超过别人活着
out超过.过度+number数量→v.在数量上超过
out超过.过度+wear穿→穿出了[洞]
out超过.过度+wit智慧→机智超出别人

Sentence.sentence: And there are some restaurants outside.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷I 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: By choosing to keep the outside of the home in great shape, you will help to improve the look and feel of the area.

Sentence.sentence: By the time the group got up to leave, it was pouring outside.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语全国卷3 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Digital technology—email and smart phones especially—have vastly improved workers' ability to be productive outside of a traditional office.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（10月） 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: Each one felt responsible for the welfare of athens, not because it was forced on him from the outside, but because the city was his pride and his safety.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Fortunately the station-master was standing outside.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（10月） 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: Give your body and brain a rest by stepping outside for a while, exercising, or dong something you enjoy.

Sentence.sentence: Good idea! Could you make sure the taxi will be waiting for me outside at 8: 00 p.m.?
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语北京卷 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: If you find something you love doing outside of the office, you'll be less likely to bring your work home.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语全国卷2 语法填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: I'll be doing some small repairs inside and outside the hotel.

Sentence.sentence: It is so cold that you can't go outside unless fully covered in thick clothes.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语江苏卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Music was his true passion, though he had never performed outside the family.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: My 10-year-old noticed him and make a comment on how bad it must be to have to stand outside in the cold wind.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语全国卷1 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Nearly 40 percent of Jazz lovers live outside of the Dallas city limits and drive or fly in to enjoy an evening in the Bishop Arts district.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 填空题 原文

Sentence.sentence: Researchers have found that there is a direct link between the increase in food eaten outside the home and the rise in weight problems.

Sentence.sentence: Snacks outside of mealtimes may be purchased by the student individually.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: The main question is whether you want your arms inside or outside the sleeping bag.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖北卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Then go outside and work out a plan to translate your childhood memories into your grown-up garden.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: They could help promote other industries whether they lie inside or outside arts.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 填空题 原文

Sentence.sentence: This cycle goes day after day: the walls warm up during the day and cool off during the night and are thus always a timely offset for the outside temperatures.

Sentence.sentence: This tip reduces outside noise so that television dialogue is clear and understandable.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: To make sure you get enough Vitamin D—but still protect your skin—put on sunscreen right as you head outside.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语全国卷I 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: Yet the bad news is students have been made to wait outside before school.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语上海卷 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: Your friend can wait outside for the discussion.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语浙江卷 阅读理解 主旨概括 原文

Sentence.sentence: In facts, the more new things we try- the more we step outside our comfort zone - the more inherently creative we become, both in the workplace and in our personal lives.
Sentence.come: 出自-2009年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In addition, the computer programs a company uses to estimate relationships may be patented and not subject to peer review or outside evaluation.

Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: And that’s the problem with a social cure engineered from the outside: in the real world, as in school, we insist on choosing our own friends.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: As of 2005, there were almost half a million professional social scientists from all fields in the world, working both inside and outside academia.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Today, professors routinely treat the progressive interpretation of history and progressive public policy as the proper subject of study while portraying conservative or classical liberal ideas —such as free markets, self-reliance—as falling outside the boundaries of routine, and sometimes legitimate, intellectual investigation.
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Manuscript will be flagged up for additional scrutiny by the journal’s internal editors, or by its existing Board of Reviewing Editors or by outside peer reviewers.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: A few decades ago, many people didn't drink water outside of a meal.
Sentence.come: 2010年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: And for women who work outside the home, they often are playing catch-up-with-household  tasks.

Sentence.sentence: And that's the problem with a social cure engineered from the outside: in the  real world, as in school, we insist on choosing our own friends.
Sentence.come: 2012年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: But the researchers believe that outside directors have an easier time of avoiding a blow to their reputations if they leave a firm before bad news breaks, even if a review of history shows they were on the board at the time any wrongdoing occurred.
Sentence.come: 2011年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: firms who want to keep their outside directors through tough times may have to create incentives.
Sentence.come: 2011年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Furthermore, the highest CEO salaries are paid to outside candidates, not to the cozy insider picks, another sign that high CEO pay is not some kind of depredation at the expense of the rest of the company.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: If the sky, and the share price is falling, outside directors should be able to give advice based on having weathered their own crises.
Sentence.come: 2011年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: If we know female job screeners are more likely to reject attractive female applicants, we can help screeners understand their biases—or hire outside screeners.
Sentence.come: 2013年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: In fact, the more new things we try - the more we step outside our comfort zone - the more inherently creative we become, both in the workplace and in our personal lives.
Sentence.come: 2009年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Manuscript will be flagged up for additional scrutiny by the journal's internal editors, or by its existing Board of Reviewing Editors or by outside peer reviewers.

Sentence.sentence: Otherwise outside directors will follow the example of Ms. Simmons, once again very popular on campus.
Sentence.come: 2011年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Outside directors are supposed to serve as helpful, yet less biased, advisers on a firm's board.
Sentence.come: 2011年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Ruth simmons joined Goldman Sachs's board as an outside director in January 2000: a year later she became president of Brown University.
Sentence.come: 2011年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: The issue of voluntary part-time relates to Obamacare because one of the main purposes was to allow people to get insurance outside of employment.
Sentence.come: 2015年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: This is why people who work outside the home have better health.

Sentence.come: 2014年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Until now, many sellers that have a physical presence in only a single state or a few states have been able to avoid charging sales taxes when they ship to addresses outside those states.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）翻译 Section Ⅲ

Sentence.sentence: You'd think this might fuel the efficiency mind-set, but in fact, Eberle notes, such ritualistic behavior helps us "step outside time's flow" into "soul time".
Sentence.come: 2016年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Young people who are still getting started in life were more likely than older adults to prioritize personal fulfillment in their work, to believe they will advance their careers most by regularly changing jobs, to favor communities with more public servi
Sentence.come: 2016年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

sentences.en: It's quite dark outside, there's no moon.
sentences.cn: 外面很黑, 没有月亮。

sentences.en: Wilson was waiting for him outside.
sentences.cn: 威尔逊在外面等他。

sentences.en: Please let us in, it's cold outside.
sentences.cn: 请让我们进去吧, 外面很冷。

sentences.en: The door was locked on the outside.
sentences.cn: 那扇门从外面锁上了。

sentences.en: One should not judge a thing by the outside.
sentences.cn: 不能从外表来判断事物。

sentences.en: He was annoyed with complaints made from outside.
sentences.cn: 他因外界的种种怨言而感到烦恼。

外部的, 在外面的, 对着外面的

sentences.cn: 所有外面的门都上了锁。

sentences.en: Work went on as usual inside, uninterrupted by outside repairs.
sentences.cn: 外部装修, 内部照常营业。

means.word_mean: 集团外的, 组织外的, 外界的, 局外的

sentences.en: They needed the outside help.
sentences.cn: 他们需要来自外界的帮助。

sentences.en: There's just an outside chance we'll get the contract after all.
sentences.cn: 说到底, 我们得到那份合同的希望极其渺茫。

means.word_mean: 可能性最大的, 最可能的

sentences.en: 150 is an outside estimate.

sentences.cn: 他们站在门外。

sentences.en: The matter is outside my area of the responsibility.
sentences.cn: 此事超出我的责任范围。

sentences.en: Outside Tom she has no real friends.
sentences.cn: 她除了汤姆之外没有真正的朋友。</seg>

(of a person) excluded from a group or activity

lj.lj_ly: a village 20 miles outside of New York.

entry.def: The outside of something is the part which surrounds or encloses the rest of it.

example.ex: ...the outside of the building...
example.tran: 建筑物的外部

example.ex: Cook over a fairly high heat until the outsides are browned.
example.tran: 用大火烹调至表面焦黄。

entry.def: If you are outside, you are not inside a building but are quite close to it.
entry.tran: 在外面；在室外；在建筑物近旁

example.ex: 'Was the car inside the garage?' — 'No, it was still outside.'...
example.tran: “车在车库里吗？”——“不，还在外面。”

example.ex: I stepped outside and pulled up my collar against the cold mist...
example.tran: 我走出门，竖起衣领抵御冷雾。

entry.def: If you are outside a room, you are not in it but are in the passage or area next to it.

example.ex: She'd sent him outside the classroom...
example.tran: 她让他到教室外面去。

example.ex: He stood in the narrow hallway just outside the door.
example.tran: 他就站在门外狭窄的走廊里。

entry.def: When you talk about the outside world, you are referring to things that happen or exist in places other than your own home or community.

example.ex: ...a side of Morris's character she hid carefully from the outside world...
example.tran: 莫里斯小心隐藏不让外人知晓的性格中的一面

example.ex: It's important to have outside interests.
example.tran: 培养一些业余爱好很重要。

entry.def: People or things outside a country, town, or region are not in it.

example.ex: ...an old castle outside Budapest...
example.tran: 布达佩斯城外的古堡

example.ex: The number of warships stationed outside European waters roughly doubled.
example.tran: 部署在欧洲水域之外的战舰数量差不多增加了一倍。

entry.def: On a road with two separate carriageways, the outside lanes are the ones which are closest to its centre.
entry.tran: （车道）靠近路中间的，快车道的

example.ex: It was travelling in the outside lane at 78mph.
example.tran: 它正以78英里的时速在快车道上疾驶。

entry.def: Outside people or organizations are not part of a particular organization or group.

example.ex: The company now makes much greater use of outside consultants.
example.tran: 该公司现在对外聘顾问的利用更加充分。

example.ex: ...church services given on Sundays by outside chaplains.
example.tran: 外请牧师主持的星期天礼拜仪式

entry.def: Outside a particular institution or field of activity means in other fields of activity or in general life.

example.ex: The condition is practically unknown outside psychiatry clinics.
example.tran: 除了医院的精神病科外，这种病几乎不为人知。

example.ex: ...the largest merger ever to take place outside the oil industry.
example.tran: 石油行业之外发生的一起有史以来规模最大的并购

entry.def: Something that is outside a particular range of things is not included within it.

example.ex: She is a beautiful boat, but way, way outside my price range...
example.tran: 这条船很漂亮，但价格却远远超出我能承受的范围。

example.ex: When Cathy sings about love, you feel that she's singing about something outside her experience.
example.tran: 凯茜在唱情歌的时候，你能感觉到她没有这方面的体验。

entry.def: Something that happens outside a particular period of time happens at a different time from the one mentioned.

example.ex: They are open outside normal daily banking hours.
example.tran: 它们在银行正常营业时间以外开放。

example.ex: ...nor does it help if your job involves working outside normal office hours.
example.tran: 工作需要加班也会有害。

entry.def: Outside of is used to introduce the only thing or person that prevents your main statement from being completely true.

example.ex: Every single relationship I've had with a man, outside of my husband, has ended in disaster.
example.tran: 除了我丈夫之外，我与所有男人的感情都以悲剧收场。

entry.def: You use at the outside to say that you think that a particular amount is the largest possible in a particular situation, or that a particular time is the latest possible time for something to happen.

example.ex: Give yourself forty minutes at the outside.
example.tran: 最多给自己留40分钟。

means.word_mean: 1. the region that is outside of something
2. the outer side or surface of something
1. relating to or being on or near the outer side or limit;

sentences.sentence: "extraneous light in the camera spoiled the photograph"

means.word_mean: 3. originating or belonging beyond some bounds:"the outside world";
4. located, suited for, or taking place in the open air;

sentences.sentence: "a beautiful outdoor setting for the wedding"

means.word_mean: 5. functioning outside the boundaries or precincts of an organized unit;
6. leading to or from the outside;
10. on or toward an outer edge;
11. (of a baseball pitch) on the far side of home plate from the batter;
